messages.message: If you go to its container folder you should see it rendered correctly at the bottom of the file browser
Ahh gotcha, any reason we don’t do it for this view? Sometimes if there’s a long list of files, it’s not very clear it could be there
I assume it's to prevent xss attacks? If we're scrubbing it for the response for the rendering in the filesystem though, we can probably do it here too? @dlluncor

correct it’s to prevent XSS attacks; if you all know how to render README.md fully without XSS please let us know and happy to help with the backend changes (just a couple line changes in the Python); I just don’t know how a way to render README.md but prevent XSS attacks
Ted and I had a conversation about it here: https://instabase.slack.com/archives/C06FA6A23/p1553180034307400
